description:
go/doc: Represent interface method declarations same ways as regular struct methods.

Updates issue 5860.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

On 2013/08/11 05:51:26, dtcaciuc wrote:
> Hello mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com,
> 
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go

Disclaimer: This may be going in a totally wrong direction, but the change was small enough to just submit a CL rather than describing it in a pseudo code.

I've ran godoc on a couple of packages and it seems to be doing the right thing, to the extent of my knowledge. There are couple of TODO's marking items I was not sure about. The intended follow-up to this would be a somewhat different CSS styling for interface types/methods in godoc (perhaps just italicize the font?)

subject: code review 12723043:     go/doc: Represent interface method declarations sam...
